summary: The study reports the directed evolution of an amine oxidase from Aspergillus niger to improve its activity and enantioselectivity towards secondary amines for preparative deracemisation.
key_claims: Directed evolution led to an enzyme variant with 50-fold enhanced activity and higher enantioselectivity towards chiral secondary amines compared to the wild-type.
The new variant showed k cat values comparable to the parent towards a-MBA and amylamine but had significantly improved K M values.
